title: Phase 6: Production hardening
description:
## Deliverables
- Robust Airtable client:
  - Batching, rate-limit handling, exponential backoff
  - Structured logs and correlation IDs per run
- Evidence bundle per sync run:
  - Run metadata, counts, diff summary, failure reasons
- Full operational runbook:
  - Setup, secrets, failure modes, rollback
- Optional: publish dist/catalog.json to static endpoint

## Acceptance Criteria
- Nightly scheduled sync job succeeds reliably
- Failures are actionable from logs + evidence bundle
- Documentation sufficient for another engineer to run and operate
- Rate limits never exceeded
- All 7 enhancements complete and documented

title: Phase 3: GitHub to Airtable sync
description:
## Deliverables
- scripts/sync_airtable.py:
  - Upsert Plugins, Skills, Documents by stable keys
  - Create/update link tables for plugin↔skill and entity↔doc
  - Never hard-delete; mark missing as status=inactive
  - Obey protected-field policy (Enhancement A)
- GitHub Action:
  - PR: DRY_RUN diff report only
  - main: performs sync
- Summary artifact: counts, errors, warnings, top gaps

## Enhancement A: Protected-field Policy
Repo→Airtable overwrites only specific fields; Airtable-only fields (notes, priority) never overwritten

## Enhancement F: Relationship inference
Store confidence=inferred and allow manual overrides in Airtable

## Acceptance Criteria
- Running sync twice yields no changes second run (idempotent)
- Link tables correctly represent relationships
- DRY_RUN produces clear diff report
- Protected fields preserved on sync

title: Phase 5: Doc linkage + quality scoring
description:
## Deliverables
- Doc-link parser: supports frontmatter OR standardized header block
- Linter/fixer script (scripts/doc_lint.py)
- Quality scoring report:
  - dist/quality_report.json
  - dist/quality_report.md with sortable tables

## Enhancement D: Doc-linking Fixer
Detect missing doc_id/doc_type/applies_to and optionally propose patch files or PR-ready diffs

## Enhancement E: Quality Scoring Dashboard
Compute completeness scores per plugin/skill:
- PRD/ADR/AAR/use-case/evidence/runbook presence
- Validator state
- Publish summary artifact and human-readable report

## Acceptance Criteria
- Clear missing PRD/ADR/AAR/use-case/evidence/runbook views via Airtable fields + report
- Fixer runs in check mode on CI and apply mode locally
- Quality scores visible in Airtable

title: P1: Add commit_sha to entities
description:
Enhancement G completion: Add commit_sha field to each plugin/skill/document entity for traceability.

## Acceptance
- Each entity has source_commit field
- Validates correctly against updated schema
close_reason: All entities now have source_commit field, CI passes

title: Phase 4: Multi-repo + incremental sync
description:
## Deliverables
- config/catalog.sources.json listing repos and parsing rules
- Support multiple checkouts and aggregation in extraction
- Incremental sync using prior dist/catalog.json or stored hash state
- Collision-safe IDs strategy documented and enforced

## Enhancement B: Incremental Sync
Compute diffs from prior catalog.json to reduce Airtable API usage and avoid rate limiting

## Enhancement G: Multi-repo Normalization
Stable ID strategy: source_repo + source_path + commit_sha avoids collisions across repos

## Acceptance Criteria
- Adds Nixtla + CCPI into one Airtable base without collisions
- Incremental sync significantly reduces Airtable operations on no-op runs
- ID collision detection and prevention

title: Phase 2: Airtable schema provisioning
description:
## Deliverables
- schema/airtable.base.json describing tables/fields/select options
- scripts/airtable_provision.py
- mappings/airtable_ids.json (table/field IDs after provision)
- GitHub Action (manual dispatch) to provision schema

## Tables Required
- Plugins
- Skills
- Documents
- PluginSkillLinks
- EntityDocLinks
- ValidationRuns (optional)

## Enhancement C: Schema as Code
Define Airtable base schema as code and auto-provision/update tables/fields/select options

## Acceptance Criteria
- Running provisioner is idempotent (safe to re-run)
- Schema matches contract including enums/select options
- Field IDs stored for sync phase

title: P1: Schema has commit tracking
description: Already done - verify schema/catalog.schema.json has commit field.

title: P1: Extractor outputs commit per entity
description: Modify extract_catalog.py to add source_commit to each entity (not just meta.repos).
close_reason: Extractor now outputs source_commit per entity

title: Catalog Airtable Sync - Master Epic
description:
Unified plugin/skill/docs catalog with deterministic extraction, validation, and GitHub Actions-driven Airtable mirror.

## Enhancements (ALL required)
- A) Protected-field policy for Airtable
- B) Incremental sync
- C) Schema provisioning as code
- D) Doc-linking standardization + fixer
- E) Quality scoring + gap dashboard
- F) Relationship inference with confidence
- G) Multi-repo normalization with collision-safe IDs

## Acceptance Criteria
- All 6 phases complete
- All 7 enhancements implemented
- Nightly sync job running reliably
- Full operational runbooks

title: Phase 1: Control-plane repo + data contract
description:
## Deliverables
- schema/catalog.schema.json (JSON Schema)
- schema/catalog.contract.md (human contract)
- scripts/extract_catalog.py builds dist/catalog.json
- scripts/validate_catalog.py validates against schema
- dist/catalog.warnings.json for non-deterministic parse issues
- CI workflow: on PR run extract+validate; on main upload artifact
- Runbooks: README.md, docs/runbook.md

## Enhancements in this phase
- F) Relationship inference with confidence (partial)
- G) Multi-repo normalization: source_repo + commit_sha per entity

## Acceptance Criteria
- make ci passes locally and in CI
- Catalog covers plugins, skills, docs
- Stable ordering (deterministic output)
- commit_sha tracked per entity

## Status
MOSTLY COMPLETE - needs commit_sha enhancement
close_reason: Phase 1 complete: schema, extractor, validator, CI all working. Enhancement G (source_commit) implemented. make ci passes.
